page.title: 02INTRODUCTION TO TYTHERINGTON
page.content: The small village of{Tytherington}is situated to the{south-east}of{ {Thornbury}at a place where 5 roads meet. This has led to an unusual settlement pattern. {Tytherington}is a quiet village. There is a lovely assortment of charming detached cottages made of a warm brown stone. Behind the houses are ornate gardens. To the north -west the buildings rise up in a slope named{Tytherington Hill}. There is a sharp contrast between the quietness of village life and the busy activity of the nearby working{quarry. People love living in{Tytherington because there is hardly any trouble and it is a pleasant and friendly atmosphere, set in an attractive landscape, despite the{M5 motorway} running close to the village.
